subtitle: Individual puddings made with mixed berries that are very simple to make.

method.text: Cut the crusts off the bread. Use to line individual ramekin dishes or moulds, reserving 2-3 slices for the top.
Place the fruit in a large pan. Add the sugar and water. Bring slowly to the boil. Cook for 2-3 min until sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the fruit to the lined pudding bowls and fill to the top.
Cover the fruit with remaining bread. Place small saucers over the dishes. Place a weight on top. Leave overnight in the fridge.
To serve, invert onto serving plates.

title: Autumn puddings
